body.div: But lest his heart exalt him in the harm Already done, to have dispeopled heaven, My damage fondly deem'd, I can repair That detriment, if such it be to lose Self-lost, and in a moment will create Another world, out of one man a race Of men innumerable, there to dwell, Not here, till by degrees of merit rais'd, They open to themselves at length the way Up hither, under long obedience try'd, And earth be chang'd to heaven, and heaven to earth, One kingdom, joy and union without end.>
